scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
CSV is included in 3 national catalogues of recommended specifications. They belong to the Netherlands, Estonia, and Sweden. The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) of these Member States is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO)factsheets.

See:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/national-interoperability-framework-observatory-nifo/nifo-factsheets

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
CSV can be considered a facilitator to publish public administrations data as open data. As 5 Stars Open Data model of Tim Berners-Lee states, CSV makes sure content is available on the web, structures data and makes it usable in a non-proprietary open format.

See:
https://5stardata.info/en/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
statement:
IETF has a formal review and approval so that all the relevant stakeholders can formally appeal or raise objections to the development and approval of specifications.

Each distinct version of an Internet standards-related specification is published as part of the "Request for Comments" (RFC) document series. This archival series is the official publication channel for Internet standards documents and other publications.

During the development of a specification, draft versions of the document are made available for informal review and comment by placing them in the IETF's "Internet-Drafts" directory, which is replicated on a number of Internet hosts. This makes an evolving working document readily available to a wide audience, facilitating the process of review and revision.

See:
https://www.ietf.org/standards/process/ 
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2026

statement:
CSV is publicly available for implementation and use, and therefore for everyone to study, for free on IETF webpage. 
See:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4180

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The standard or specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
Like all the IETF standards, CSV is a free and open technical specification, built on IETF standards and licenses from the Open Web Foundation. CSV is therefore licensed on a royalty-free basis.
No IPR disclosures have been submitted directly on the IPv6 specification (RFC 2818).
See:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3668

statement:

criterion_description: The standard or specification is sufficiently mature and has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
CSV is one of the most popular formats for publishing data on the web. An example of those developments is CSV Dialect which aims to deal with a reasonably large subset of the features which differ between dialect.
Add history, structured data, support from wide range of organisations (private and public)
See:
https://frictionlessdata.io/specs/csv-dialect/

statement:
The specifications promotes innovation as CSV Dialect to simplify the format to be able to describe various CSV dialects.
Rewrite, more detail
See:
https://frictionlessdata.io/specs/csv-dialect/

criterion_description: The standard or specification has a strong support from at least one developer community.
statement:
CSV has been developed and maintained by IETF. Additionally, the W3C has published a recommendation enhancing specific features of the specification. Both organisation are International Organisations concerned with the development of the Internet.  
See: 
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4180
https://www.w3.org/TR/tabular-data-model/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the visibility and comprehensibility of administrative rules, processes, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement: As a common data exchange format, CSV fosters the visibility of administration's data. It eases the publication of structured data for the consumption by the different stakeholders. Therefore, CSV fosters the visibility of administrations data. Additionally, it can be used internally easing as well de decision-making process.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification helps ensuring the availability of interfaces with internal information systems of a public administration.
statement: The purpose of CSV is not related to the availability assurance. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

criterion_description: The standard or specification is reusable beyond the domain for which it was originally developed.
statement: The specification being assessed is a sector agnostic specification that is able to be reused when structured data needs to be exchanged. Additionally, CSV is designed to enable you to reuse the same schema when publishing multiple CSV files, even if those files are created by different organisations and therefore reside in different places.

statement:

See:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4180

CSV has documentation regarding Use Cases and Requirements which analyses its efficiency.

See:
https://www.w3.org/TR/csvw-ucr/

criterion_description: The standard or specification can be mapped to the EIRA.
statement:
CSV is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). Specifically, CSV can define the interoperability aspects of the "Representation" ABB of the EIRA Semantic View.
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/distribution/eliscataloguev100betaxlsx

criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the standard or specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
There are several CSV conformance validators available. An example is CSV Lint, which provides a conformance validation for its readability. Another example is CSV Validator from The National Archive of United Kingdom. This validator provides tools for validating CSV by using CSV Schema. 

See:
https://csvlint.io/
https://github.com/digital-preservation/csv-validator

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The standard or specification is recommended by a EU Member State.
statement:
8 Member States are recommending CSV in their ICT National Catalogues. 
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been selected for its use in a EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
CSV is a commonly used format for data exchange. It allows to provide data in a simple way. Moreover, as is structured data and non-proprietary format it eases data consumption by different stakeholders. 

An example of initiative relaying on CSV to provide data to users is ESCO, that allows the download data sets in CSV format. 

See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/esco/portal/escopedia/Comma-separated_values__40_CSV_41_#ESCO_data_in_CSV_files

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
The specification is included in 8 Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications. Some examples of Member States including CSV on their catalogues are the Netherlands, Slovenia or Sweden.
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
After being evaluated compliant with the regulation on standardisation 1025/2012, CSV has been identified by Commission Implementing Decision and included in the European list of ICT Standards for e-procurement.

See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement:
After being evaluated compliant with the regulation on standardisation 1025/2012, CSV has been identified by Commission Implementing Decision. During the evaluation process, all the Member States are invited to share their doubts. The positive evaluation of CSV and its identification is considered an interoperability agreement.

See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

criterion_description: The standard or specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
After being evaluated compliant with the regulation on standardisation 1025/2012, CSV has been identified by Commission Implementing Decision.

See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

statement: The purpose of CSV is not related  to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

criterion_description: The standard or specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement: The purpose of CSV is not related to organisational interoperability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement: CSV is a text plain document which uses comma to separate values. Lines in a document are data records and records consists one or more fields. Therefore, CSV does not define a cross-sector reusable data model.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
CSV is one of the main points on the publication of Open Data. Using the specification 3 out of 5 stars from Tim Berners Lee's schema for open data are supported. 

Moreover, some initiatives for the publication of European Organisations data as open data, consequently Linked Open Data have their datasets stored in CSV format. An example of it is the EU Open Data Portal. 

See: 
https://data.europa.eu/euodp/en/home
https://5stardata.info/en/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is available for free on at least one national or European platform.
statement:
CSV is included in the ICT Standards List identified for its use in eProcurent at Joinup. Despite the specification cannot be downloaded directly from the European Platform, CSV is a IETF specification that can be reused for free. 

See:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4180
